events.description: The first policy meeting of the European Central Bank in 2026 where interest rates were held steady.
A press conference following the ECB policy meeting to discuss the economic outlook and inflation.

facts.fact_text: The European Central Bank left interest rates unchanged at its first policy meeting of 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: The European Central Bank left interest rates unchanged at its first policy meeting of 2026, in line with expectations

facts.fact_text: The interest rate on main refinancing operations was maintained at 2.15%, deposit facility at 2.0%, and marginal lending at 2.4%.

evidences.evidence_text: The interest rate on the main refinancing operations was maintained at 2.15%, while the deposit facility and marginal lending rates were kept at 2.0% and 2.4%, respectively.

claims.claim_text: Inflation is expected to stabilize at the 2% target over the medium term.
claims.author: European Central Bank

evidences.evidence_text: reiterating that inflation is expected to stabilize at its 2% target over the medium term.

claims.claim_text: The euro area economy remains resilient.
claims.author: ECB

evidences.evidence_text: The ECB said the euro area economy remains resilient, supported by low unemployment, healthy private-sector balance sheets

claims.claim_text: The economic outlook remains uncertain due to global trade policy risks and geopolitical tensions.
claims.author: Policymakers

evidences.evidence_text: policymakers cautioned that the outlook remains uncertain, particularly due to global trade policy risks and ongoing geopolitical tensions.

evidence.evidence_text: the euro area economy remains resilient, supported by low unemployment
policymakers cautioned that the outlook remains uncertain, particularly due to global trade policy risks
assessing the impact of a stronger euro on the inflation outlook.
